intro: Verbesina subdiscoidea, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Verbesina subdiscoidea is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
